jobs.title: Executive Assistant
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Unto Labs

Unto Labs is a team of low-level engineers pushing distributed systems to the the physical limits of modern hardware. We are building the next generation of Layer 1 blockchain technology and the consumer applications that will bring it to millions of people worldwide.

We are looking for an Executive Assistant who can partner closely with our founders to unblock their time to stay focused on strategy and engineering.

Role Overview / Why This Role Matters

As an Executive Assistant, you’ll serve as a trusted right hand to our company founders. You won’t just keep calendars but help streamline operations and be front line support for internal company matters.

Key Responsibilities

Executive & Strategic Support

  • Manage complex calendars, prioritizing and resolving conflicts

  • Act as a gatekeeper / filter for inbound requests, balancing urgency vs importance

Operations & Administration

  • Oversee payroll, travel, event, and other operational logistics (in coordination with finance/HR)

  • Manage vendor contracts, invoices, and expense processes

  • Coordinate internal systems, tools, and process improvements

  • Ensure smooth office operations (even if hybrid / remote) and onboarding/offboarding of employees.

Events & Programs

  • Plan, coordinate, and execute company and team events (offsites, all hands, social, recruiting events)

  • Manage event logistics, budgeting, vendor relationships, travel, venues

  • Lead internal culture programs, wellness or team ritual events

Immigration / Global Mobility

  • Manage immigration / visa processes for international hires (work with outside counsel)

  • Track visa timelines, renewals, compliance

  • Serve as point of contact for global employees and legal / immigration teams

Cross-Functional Projects & Stakeholder Management

  • Lead, coordinate or support cross-functional initiatives (e.g., onboarding improvements, internal infrastructure projects)

  • Work to assist HR, Finance, Legal, Engineering, People Operations, Recruiting operations.

  • Serve as liaison to external partners, service providers, travel agencies, legal counsel

Miscellaneous & Special Requests

  • Be ready to take on ad hoc requests and emergent priorities

  • Travel with executives when needed

  • Occasionally support personal tasks when appropriate (within boundaries)

Qualifications & Attributes

Must-haves / Required

  • Strong track record of owning operations and executing cross-functional programs

  • Excellent verbal & written communication, high emotional intelligence, discretion

  • Superb organization skills, attention to detail, bias toward proactivity

  • Ability to juggle many competing priorities and pivot when needed

  • Comfortable with ambiguity; ability to create structure

  • Strong judgment, confidentiality, and professionalism

Nice-to-haves

  • Experience managing payroll, HR systems, or global mobility / immigration

  • Experience in event planning (onsite + offsite)

  • Familiarity with finance, invoicing, legal, or contract management

  • Multi-lingual or experience working across geographies

  • An interest in crypto and/or blockchain

Work Setup / Preferences

  • In-person San Francisco

  • Must be open to frequent travel

  • Part-time candidates will be considered if able to travel and meet deliverables

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary

  • Flexible work arrangements, generous vacation

  • Comprehensive health, dental, vision benefits

  • Learning & training stipend, conference budget

  • Travel reimbursement, work equipment & tools

  • A seat at the table: your voice will matter in how we scale

How to Apply

Please submit your resume and a short cover letter explaining:

  1. Why you want to work with Unto Labs

  2. Examples of projects / programs you’ve managed end-to-end

  3. Any experience with payroll, immigration, or events

  4. Your interest in crypto and/or blockchain

jobs.title: Systems Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Unto Labs

Unto Labs is a team of low-level engineers pushing distributed systems to the physical limits of modern hardware. We’re reimagining blockchains, from core consensus primitives to performance-tuned networking stacks, in the service of global scale applications.

About the role

We're seeking a Systems Engineer to take on the toughest challenges in distributed, high-performance computing. You'll be responsible for designing and building key parts of a base-layer blockchain, focused on juicing every last ounce of performance from commodity hardware. As a member of our fast-paced team, you'll work across the entire modern blockchain stack, including cryptography, consensus, distributed systems, and core kernels.

Responsibilities

  • Design systems for robust process isolation

  • Build and test high-performance sub-systems from scratch in C, focusing on cryptographic operations, consensus mechanisms, and networking

  • Implement advanced error correction and data recovery mechanisms

  • Build and contribute to a suite of custom benchmarking and performance testing tools

Qualifications

  • Deep expertise in systems programming languages (C, C++, Rust) with a focus on performance optimization

  • Experience and understanding of modern CPU architectures, memory hierarchies, and low-level optimization techniques

  • Expertise in high-performance networking and protocol design

  • Understanding of distributed systems and consensus algorithms

Why join us?

  • Be at the forefront of blockchain technology, working on next-generation performance optimization, on a small, fast-moving, tight-knit team

  • Work with a team of experts with deep expertise in high-frequency trading and scaling developer ecosystems

  • Shape the architecture of a system designed to process millions of transactions per second

  • Access to cutting-edge hardware and development tools

Compensation and Benefits

  • Competitive salary ($180k-$250k+ USD)

  • Significant equity and upside potential

  • Flexible work environment

  • Unlimited vacation policy

  • Health insurance

  • Hardware and development tool allowance

  • Conference and learning budget
